question: 根本
sourceAnswer:
<read>ねもと</read>:<tag><ja>根元</ja></tag>:: base-(of-a-plant,-tree,-pillar,-etc.)/(part-near-the)-root/roots-(of-one's-hair) | root-(e.g.-of-a-problem)/source
<read>こんぽん</read>|<read>こんぼん</read>:: root/source/origin | foundation/basis/essence
activeAnswer:
<read>ねもと</read>:<tag><ja>根元</ja></tag>:: base-(of-a-plant,-tree,-pillar,-etc.)/(part-near-the)-root/roots-(of-one's-hair) | root-(e.g.-of-a-problem)/source
<read>こんぽん</read>|<read>こんぼん</read>:: root/source/origin | foundation/basis/essence
sourceMnemonic: The <kanji>root</kanji> <kanji>origin</kanji> is the <vocabulary>root</vocabulary> of something. Possibly even more root than root, but we'll stick with root.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well. Careful, <ja>本</ja> is <ja>ぽん</ja>, which is a weird rendaku.
